message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Vote on "constitutive character" for 德">
The author proposes a compromise: "constitutive character" for 德.

This combines:
- "Constitutive" (from chinese-phil-expert) — signals constructivism, neutral on innate/constructed, philosophical pedigree
- "Character" (from wittgenstein/existentialism/phil-mind) — avoids 性/nature collision, universal ("the character of water"), no moral baggage

Format: "constitutive character (德 De)" at first occurrence, then "constitutive character" in running text.

Quick vote: YES or NO? If no, say what's better in one sentence.
</teammate-message>

input.summary: YES with caveat on shortening in dense passages
input.content: YES. Same caveat as before: give the translator license to shorten to "character" alone in passages where 德 appears four or more times in quick succession, reintroducing "constitutive" when the constructivist dimension needs re-emphasis.

routing.summary: YES with caveat on shortening in dense passages
routing.content: YES. Same caveat as before: give the translator license to shorten to "character" alone in passages where 德 appears four or more times in quick succession, reintroducing "constitutive" when the constructivist dimension needs re-emphasis.
